metadata.title: CVE-2023-1670 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw use after free in the Linux kernel Xircom 16-bit PCMCIA (PC-card)Ethernet driver was found.A local user could use this flaw to crash thesystem or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1670` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-214.225
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-214.225').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1143.148').
